The argument of the day: scientists have shown that men joke better than women
01 Nov 2019, 12:15 by Daria Gromova
Female comedians are indignant.
Psychologist Jill Greengross of Aberystwyth University and colleagues from North Carolina have evaluated humor in people of different sexes. Their goal was to find out whether the stereotype that men have a better sense of humor than women is true.
Gringoss noted in an article on Psychology Today:
This stereotype is shared by both men and women - but, of course, this does not mean that it is fair.
Scientists analyzed data from 28 previous studies, in which psychologists evaluated how well developed the sense of humor in the subjects. A total of 5,027 people took part in the tests.
In most of these tests, participants were asked to come up with funny text for the comic book. The results were anonymized and evaluated by independent judges. After analyzing all the data, it turned out that 63% of men have the ability to invent jokes better than the average woman.
But Greengross clarifies:
The fact that, according to statistics, men joke better does not mean that any man has a better sense of humor than any woman. History knows many excellent comedian girls - including Sarah Silverman, Tina Frey, Ali Wong, Lucille Ball, Joan Rivers and many others. Each of them jokes better than 99.9% of men.
The team also put forward a theory with which this may be related. It is proved that evolutionary humor played an important role in finding a partner. During the time of hunting and gathering, it served as an indicator of the mind, which is why during the evolution women preferred such partners. Men, on the contrary, liked it when a woman laughed at his jokes.
As a result, a sense of humor became an object of competition among men precisely as a way to impress a woman. At the same time, the sense of humor of the woman herself has not historically been so important for men.
The reaction to this study was explosive on the part of female comedians. Eleanor Morton, Marina Bai and other girls called him "meaningless" and "boring."
